  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath1 be a von neumann algebra with a specified normal faithful tracial state @xmath2 .",
    "the free entropy dimension @xmath3 for @xmath4 , was introduced by voiculescu  @xcite , @xcite , see also  @xcite .",
    "this quantity is sometimes called the microstates free entropy dimension to distinquish it from another version introduced by voiculescu and because its definition utilizes matricial microstates for the operators @xmath5 .",
    "it is an open problem whether the quantity   is an invariant of the von neumann algebra generated by @xmath5 , and it is of interest to find the free entropy dimension of various operators .",
    "see , for example  @xcite , @xcite @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite for some such results .    in  @xcite , dykema , jung and shlyakhtenko computed @xmath6 for the quasinilpotent dt - operator @xmath7 .",
    "this operator was introduced by dykema and haagerup in  @xcite .",
    "it can be realized as a limit in @xmath8moments of strictly upper - triangular random matrices with i.i.d .",
    "complex gaussian entries above the diagonal . alternatively , as was seen in @xcite , @xmath7 can be obtained in the free group factor @xmath9 from a semicircular element @xmath10 and a free copy of @xmath11)$ ] by using projections from the latter to cut out the upper triangular part of @xmath10 .",
    "( note that @xmath10 may be replaced by a circular element @xmath12 for this procedure . )",
    "then we can visualize @xmath7 as in figure  [ figure1 ] ,    , width=151 ]    where the shaded region has weight 1 , the unshaded region has weight 0 , and these weights are used to multiply entries of a gaussian random matrix .",
    "it was proved in @xcite that the von neumann algebra generated by @xmath7 contains all of @xmath13)$ ] , and is , thus , the free group factor @xmath9 .    in this paper",
    "we consider more general operators than @xmath7 , defined also as limits of random matrices or , equivalently , in the approach was taken in @xcite , by cutting a circular operator @xmath12 using projections in a @xmath14free copy of @xmath11)$ ] . the class of operators considered there consisted of those @xmath11)$]-circular operators described as follows .",
    "let @xmath15 be an absolutely continuous measure with respect to lebesgue measure on @xmath16 ^ 2 $ ] with radon  nikodym derivative @xmath17 ^ 2)$ ] and assume the push  forward measures @xmath18 under the coordinate projections @xmath19",
    "^ 2\\to [ 0,1]$ ] are absolutely continuous with respect to lebesgue measure and have essentially bounded radon  nikodym derivatives . for each such measure @xmath15 with the associated function @xmath17 ^ 2)$ ] we have the operator @xmath20 described in  @xcite ; ( however , this operator was denoted @xmath21 in  @xcite ) .",
    "when @xmath15 is lebesgue measure on @xmath16 ^ 2 $ ] , then @xmath22 and @xmath20 is the usual circular operator .",
    "when @xmath15 is the restriction of lebesgue measure to the upper triangle pictured in figure  [ figure1 ] , then @xmath23 is the characteristic function of this triangle and @xmath20 is the quasinilpotent dt - operator @xmath7 .    let @xmath24)$ ] be the identity map from @xmath16 $ ] to itself ; thus , @xmath25 generates @xmath13)$ ] . in this paper , with @xmath23 as above , we compute the free entropy dimension @xmath26 of @xmath27 in the presence of @xmath25 , in the case @xmath23 satisfies certain additional hypothesis , showing that then @xmath28 where @xmath29 is the measurable support of @xmath23 and where the area is lebesgue measure .",
    "we prove the upper bound @xmath30 in   for general @xmath23 , ( see theorem  [ main2 ] ) using basic estimates inspired by  @xcite . we prove the lower bound @xmath31 in   for all @xmath23 that are supported in the upper triangle as drawn in figure  [ figure1 ] and whose restrictions to some band as drawn in figure  [ fig : band ] are nonzero constant .",
    "( actually , somewhat weaker conditions suffice  see theorem  [ main ] . )",
    "our proof of the lower bound uses techniques similar to those used in  @xcite .",
    "the organization of the rest of this paper is as follows . in   [ sec : defprelims ] , we discuss some definitions and results that we need for the calculation .",
    "these include (  [ subsec : linf ] ) basic facts about the class of @xmath13)$]circular operators that we consider , their construction in @xmath9 and a lemma about them ; (  [ subsec : microt ] ) a result about certain matrix approximants to the quasinilpotent dt  operator which was lifted from  @xcite but that follows directly from work of aagaard and haagerup  @xcite and niady  @xcite ; (  [ subsec : packing ] ) jung s equivalent approach to free entropy dimension in terms of packing numbers  @xcite ; (  [ subsec : dyson ] ) dyson s formula for the volumes of sets of matrices that are invariant under unitary conjugation .",
    "in   [ sec : fedbounds ] , we prove the main result , namely the equation  . finally , in   [ sec : concl ] , we consider an example when @xmath32 and we ask a natural question .",
    "_ acknowledgement : _ the first named author thanks kenley jung for helpful comments .",

    "it was proved by aagard and haagerup @xcite that if we consider @xmath7 a dt@xmath137-operator and @xmath138 a circular operator that is @xmath14free from @xmath7 ( and @xmath25 ) , then the brown measure of @xmath139 is equal to the uniform distribution on the closed disk centered at 0 and of radius @xmath140 .",
    "note how slowly this disk shrinks as @xmath141 approaches to 0 .",
    "moreover , they also showed that the spectrum of @xmath139 is equal to the disk .",
    "the next lemma is an immediate consequence of the above described brown measure result of aagaard and haagerup and a result of niady @xcite .",
    "a detailed proof can be formulated exactly as was done for lemma 2.2 in @xcite . in the following lemma and throughout this paper , for a matrix @xmath142 we let @xmath143 , where @xmath144 is the normalized trace of @xmath145 .",

    "we will review the packing number formulation of voiculecu s microstates free entropy dimension due to k. jung @xcite .",
    "if @xmath166 and @xmath167 are tuples of selfadjoint elements in a tracial von neumann algebra , then the microstates free entropy dimension ( as defined by voiculescu @xcite ) is given by the formula @xmath168 and the microstates free entropy dimension in the presence of @xmath12 is defined by @xmath169 where @xmath170 is a semicircular family free from @xmath10 and @xmath12 .",

    "let @xmath176 and @xmath177 be arbitrary tuples of possibly non - selfadjoints elements in a tracial von neumann algebra",
    ". now the definition of @xmath178 makes perfect sense for the set @xmath138 if we replace the microstates space in ( [ pack ] ) with the non - selfadjoint @xmath8microstates space @xmath179 , which is the set of all @xmath180tuples of @xmath181 matrices whose @xmath8moments up to order @xmath182 approximate those of @xmath138 within tolerance of @xmath183 in the presence of @xmath184 .",

    "we thus have the volume comparison test , @xmath195      every matrix of @xmath145 has an upper - triangular matrix in its unitary orbit .",
    "thus , letting @xmath196 denote the set of upper - triangular matrices in @xmath145 , there is a probability measure @xmath197 on @xmath196 such that @xmath198 for every @xmath199 that is invariant under unitary conjugation .",

    "<S> we find the microstates free entropy dimension of a large class of @xmath0$]circular operators , in the presence of a generator of the diagonal subalgebra . </S>"
